title: 106_s3
content:
The "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" includes a 10 percent reduction in individual income tax rates. No amendment made by this Act will be considered a change in tax rates for tax purposes. The "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" includes a 10 percent reduction in individual income tax rates for married individuals filing joint returns and surviving spouses. For taxable income over $43,050, the tax rate is 13.5%. For income over $43,050 but not over $104,050, the tax is $5,811.75 plus 25.2% of the excess. For income over $104,050 but not over $158,550, the tax is $21,183.75 plus 27.9% of the excess. For income over $158,550 but not over $283,150, the tax is $36,389.25 plus 32.4% of the excess. For heads of households, taxable income over $158,550 incurs a tax of $36,389.25 plus 32.4% of the excess. Income over $283,150 is taxed at $76,759.65 plus 35.64% of the excess. Tax rates for taxable income levels:
- Not over $34,550: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $34,550 but not over $89,150: $4,664.25 plus 25.2% of excess over $34,550
- Over $89,150 but not over $144,400: $18,423.45 plus 27.9% of excess over $89,150
- Over $144,400 but not over $283,150: $33,838.20 plus 32.4% of excess over $144,400 Tax rates for taxable income levels:
- Over $144,400 but not over $283,150: $33,838.20 plus 32.4% of excess
- Over $283,150: $78,793.20 plus 35.64% of excess
- Tax imposed on unmarried individuals who are not surviving spouses or heads of households. For unmarried individuals who are heads of households, a tax is determined based on a specific table. For unmarried individuals who are heads of households, the tax rates are as follows:
- Not over $25,750: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $25,750 but not over $62,450: $3,476.25, plus 25.2% of the excess over $25,750
- Over $62,450 but not over $130,250: $12,724.65, plus 27.9% of the excess over $62,450
- Over $130,250 but not over $283,150: $31,640.85, plus 32.4% of the excess over $130,250. For married individuals filing separate returns, the tax rates are as follows:
- Over $130,250 but not over $283,150: $31,640.85, plus 32.4% of the excess over $130,250
- Over $283,150: $81,180.45, plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. Tax rates for taxable income levels are as follows:
- Not over $21,525: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $21,525 but not over $52,025: $2,905.87, plus 25.2% of the excess
- Over $52,025 but not over $79,275: $10,591.87, plus 27.9% of the excess
- Over $79,275 but not over $141,575: $18,194.62, plus 32.4% of the excess
- Over $141,575: Varies The tax rates for estates and trusts are as follows:
- Over $79,275: $18,194.62 plus 32.4% of the excess
- Over $141,575: $38,379.82 plus 35.64% of the excess For taxable income over $1,750, the tax rates are as follows:
- Over $1,750 but not over $4,050: $236.25 plus 25.2% of the excess
- Over $4,050 but not over $6,200: $815.85 plus 27.9% of the excess
- Over $6,200 but not over $8,450: $1,415.70 plus 32.4% of the excess
- Over $8,450: 13.5% of taxable income Inflation adjustments made to tax rates for taxable income over $8,450. The tax code is amended by changing the year from 1992 to 1998 in various sections. The tax code is amended in various sections, including Section 63(c)(4)(B), Section 68(b)(2)(B), Section 135(b)(2)(B)(ii), Section 151(d)(4), Section 220(g)(2), Section 221(g)(1)(B), Section 512(d)(2)(B), Section 513(h)(2)(C)(ii), Section 685(c)(3)(B), Section 877(a)(2), Section 911(b)(2)(D)(ii)(II), Section 2032A(a)(3)(B), Section 2503(b)(2)(B), Section 2631(c)(1)(B), and Section 4001(e)(1)(B). The tax code is further amended in various sections, including Section 2032A(a)(3)(B), Section 2503(b)(2)(B), Section 2631(c)(1)(B), Section 4001(e)(1)(B), and others. Subclause (II) of section 42(h)(6)(G)(i) is updated from "1987" to "1998", and subparagraph (B) of section 132(f)(6) is modified. In the tax code amendments, section 132(f)(6)(B) is updated by substituting "calendar year 1992" for "calendar year 1998". Additionally, section 1(g)(7)(B)(ii)(II) is changed from "15 percent" to "13.5 percent", and section 1(h) is modified to replace "28 percent" with "25.2 percent" in certain paragraphs. In the tax code amendments, various sections are updated by replacing percentages with new values. For example, section 531 and 541 are changed from "39.6 percent" to "35.64 percent", section 3402(p)(1)(B) is updated from "7, 15, 28, or 31 percent" to "7, 13.5, 25.2 or 27.9 percent", and section 3402(p)(2) is modified from "15 percent" to "13.5 percent". The tax code is updated by replacing percentages with new values in various sections. For example, section 3402(p)(2) is changed from "15 percent" to "13.5 percent", section 3402(q)(1) is updated from "28 percent" to "25.2 percent", and section 3402(r)(3) is modified from "31 percent" to "27.9 percent". These changes will apply to taxable years. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1998, with specific withholding provisions applying to amounts paid after the same date.
